action.action-desc: Mr. Putnam (for himself, Mr. Klein of Florida, Mr. Bilirakis, Mr. Miller of Florida, Mr. Buchanan, Ms. Kosmas, Ms. Corrine Brown of Florida, Mr. Crenshaw, Mr. Lincoln Diaz-Balart of Florida, Ms. Ginny Brown-Waite of Florida, Ms. Wasserman Schultz, Ms. Ros-Lehtinen, Mr. Wexler, Mr. Posey, Mr. Rooney, Mr. Roe of Tennessee, Mrs. Capito, Mr. Campbell, Mr. Baca, Mr. Teague, Mr. Gutierrez, Mr. Snyder, and Mr. Lee of New York) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Veterans’ Affairs

form.official-title: To amend title 38, United States Code, to provide for entitlement under the Post-9/11 Educational Assistance Program to payment for test preparatory courses, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Test Prep for Heroes Act.

section.header: Post-9/11 educational assistance for test preparatory courses

subsection.text: Section 3315 of title 38, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (a), by inserting before the period the following: and one test preparatory course;

subparagraph.text: by inserting total before amount payable;
by inserting and test preparatory course after licensing or certification test; and

clause.text: by inserting aggregate amount equal to the before fee; and
by inserting plus the fee charged for the test preparatory course after the test; and

paragraph.text: by adding at the end the following new subsection:

subsection.text: In this section, the term test preparatory course means—

paragraph.text: a preparatory course for a test that is required or used for admission to an institution of higher education;
or a preparatory course for a test that is required or used for admission to a graduate school.
The heading for section 3315 of title 38, United States Code, is amended by inserting after tests the following: ; test preparatory courses.
The table or sections at the beginning of chapter 33 of such title is amended by striking the item relating to section 3315 and inserting the following:

subsection.text: The amendments made by this Act shall take effect _____.
